intro: Haplophyllum lasianthum, commonly known as the white-flowered rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows in rocky or coastal environments. The plant features small, clustered white flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in arid conditions. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its unique floral structure and drought tolerance.
